I have created a CD Booteable with NOD32DOS and this one is executed perfectly, the only one problem that I have is that it me does not recognize the hard disks, i want that was recognizing these and if is possible also devices USB. The configuration of autoexec.bat is ``` @ECHO OFF MSCDEX.EXE /D:CDDRIVER /L:X XMSDSK.EXE 102400 R: /t /y CTMOUSE.EXE PATH=A:\;R:\ GOTO %CONFIG% :NOD32DOS COPY X:\NOD32DOS\*.* R: R:\nod32dos.exe x:\ GOTO DOS :DOS ECHO X: CD DRIVE ECHO R: RAM DRIVE ```
The configuration of config.sys is ``` [MENU] menuitem=NOD32DOS, nod32dos [DOS] DEVICE=OAKCDROM.SYS /D:CDDRIVER /L:X [NOD32DOS] include=DOS [COMMON] LASTDRIVE=Z ```

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Well, you cannot expect a "plain" DOS system to see: * any FAT32 or NTFS formatted filesystem (if DOS version up to 6.22) * any NTFS formatted filesystem (if DOS version 7.x or 8.0) * any device on a BUS like USB, Firewire, SCSI for which DOS has NOT native support unless you load a specific BUS stack and driver.
Teere are solutions for the latter two problems, don't think there is one for first one. Since it is unlikely that you will find a tutorial/reference wahtever for BOTH 2. and 3. together, you may want to search separately for "NTFS support DOS" aand for "USB support DOS". jaclaz
